page.title: 14THE GLIDING CLUB
page.content: The Gliding Club which covers an area of 10 hectares at the top of Sutton Bank has been in existance since 1930. The land was purchased from the Church Authorities in 1953. Many of the members who pay Â£86 per annum come from the West Riding of Yorkshire. The fibreglass gliders cost between Â£5000 and Â£25000 each,yearly insurance is 8% of the value. Most of the 45 gliders at the club are owned by syndicates. The club own two gliders and two pipers which are used for towing. It would cost approximately Â£400 to learn to fly solo using a club machine and instructor. Eight people are employed at the club, 4 on the flying side, 3 in the kitchen and 1 and a part_timer in the office. The club house was built in 1962.
